intro: Lappula californica var. mundula, commonly known as the California lappula, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as smartweeds. This variety is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides. The plant is an annual, meaning it completes its life cycle within one growing season.
